results.name: Triangle, read by rows, such that the convolution of each row with {1,2} produces a triangle which, when flattened, equals this flattened form of the original triangle.
comment: First column and main diagonal forms A092687. Row sums form A092688.

This triangle is the cascadence of binomial (1+2x). More generally, the cascadence of polynomial F(x) of degree d, F(0)=1, is a triangle with d*n+1 terms in row n where the g.f. of the triangle, A(x,y), is given by: A(x,y) = ( x*H(x) - y*H(x*y^d) )/( x*F(y) - y ), where H(x) satisfies: H(x) = G*H(x*G^d)/x and G=G(x) satisfies: G(x) = x*F(G(x)) so that G = series_reversion(x/F(x)); also, H(x) is the g.f. of column 0. - _Paul D. Hanna_, Jul 17 2006
link: Paul D. Hanna, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..495
formula: G.f.: A(x,y) = ( x*H(x) - y*H(x*y) )/( x*(1+2y) - y ), where H(x) satisfies: H(x) = H(x^2/(1-2x))/(1-2x) and H(x) is the g.f. of column 0 (A092687). - _Paul D. Hanna_, Jul 17 2006
